definition: stranger
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: The noise of dogs made me a stranger here.
sentences.chinese: 狗吠聲讓我變成異鄉人，讓我止步難前。

sentences.english: There are many things that as a stranger initially threw me for a loop.
sentences.chinese: 最初，有很多事讓我這個初來乍到的異鄉人眩暈。

sentences.english: He is a stranger in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在紐約他是一個異鄉人。

sentences.english: The stranger paused a moment in revery before this tender and calming spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 這個異鄉人在那種溫柔寧靜的景物前出了一會神。

sentences.english: When Americans discover that you are a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 當美國人發現你是一位異鄉人的時候。

sentences.english: East of the river, strangers from across the seas were seen less seldom.
sentences.chinese: 而在河東岸，狹海對面的異鄉人則少見的多。

sentences.english: And you are not a pining outcast amongst strangers?
sentences.chinese: 你沒有憔悴不堪，流落在異鄉人中間嗎？

sentences.english: Who dressed you, love, as a foreigner?
sentences.chinese: 是誰把你，我的情人，裝扮成一個異鄉人？

sentences.english: Chapter four discusses the stranger's pursuit of ideal home.
sentences.chinese: 第四章主要論述異鄉人對理想家園的追尋。

definition: foreign land/a place far from home
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
reluctant to part
with complex feelings (idiom)
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
separated in life and death/to part for ever
linked in countless ways
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
gloomy
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to be homesick
Getting Home, 2007 PRC comedy-drama film directed by 張揚|张扬[Zhang1 Yang2], starring 趙本山|赵本山[Zhao4 Ben3 shan1]
lit. a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom)/fig. all things go back to their source eventually/in old age, an expatriate returns home
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
unspeakable/indescribable
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
